title: Ricotta Gnocchi with Tomato Basil
description: Light, pillowy ricotta gnocchi tossed in a bright fresh tomato-basil sauce with garlic and olive oil. Quick pan-seared finish gives the gnocchi a tender interior and lightly crisp edges for a comforting Italian-style weeknight meal.

ingredients.notes: well drained (place in fine sieve or cheesecloth for 20–30 minutes beforehand)

ingredients.display_name: all-purpose flour, plus extra for dusting
ingredients.notes: start with measured amount, add more if dough is sticky

ingredients.display_name: grated parmesan (or pecorino), plus extra for serving

steps.text: Drain ricotta thoroughly: place ricotta in a fine-mesh sieve lined with cheesecloth over a bowl and let drain for 20–30 minutes (or press gently) until much of the liquid is removed.
Meanwhile, make the tomato-basil sauce: heat 2 tbsp olive oil in a sauté pan over medium heat, add minced garlic and cook until fragrant but not browned, about 30 seconds to 1 minute.

Add diced tomatoes and 1/2 tsp salt to the pan, bring to a gentle simmer, and cook, stirring occasionally, until tomatoes break down and sauce thickens slightly, about 10 minutes. Stir in torn basil and optional butter and lemon zest near the end; keep warm off heat.

Combine gnocchi dough: transfer drained ricotta to a large bowl, add beaten egg, grated parmesan, remaining salt and pepper, then sprinkle in about half the flour and gently fold to combine. Add remaining flour a little at a time until a soft, slightly sticky dough forms—do not overwork.

Shape gnocchi: dust work surface with flour, divide dough into portions, roll each into a 1-inch diameter rope, then cut into 1-inch pieces. If desired, roll pieces over a fork or gnocchi board to create ridges; lightly dust with flour to prevent sticking.

Bring a large pot of salted water to a rolling boil. Cook gnocchi in batches: drop pieces into boiling water and cook until they float and are tender, about 2–3 minutes per batch. Remove with a slotted spoon into a colander and reserve.

Finish gnocchi in the pan: heat remaining 1 tbsp olive oil in a large sauté pan over medium-high heat. Add cooked gnocchi in a single layer and sear until lightly golden on one side, 2–3 minutes, then toss gently to brown other sides, about 1–2 more minutes.
Toss gnocchi with warm tomato-basil sauce in the pan to coat, adjust seasoning with salt and pepper, and serve immediately topped with extra grated parmesan and torn basil.
